body: Thanks @kaxil
@ashb Can we include this in 1.10, please ??? 😉

Thanks for the review. I'll try to add a test case about passing password.

There is a CLI command merged to master by @XD-DENG that shows the next execution date
https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3834
Maybe this PR can use the logic already merged to master to populate the values to the UI.

Also duplicate Jira ticket for this:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2618
@xnuinside I think there are many people facing the issue so I think we should get this in. Thanks @xnuinside :)
Does this also apply to `upgradedb`? I counsel people against running initdb in production (because it creates all the sample connections which is often not what people want.

hey guys,

is there any ETA for this PR?

Btw, could you also update the documentation and release notes for 1.10 to clarify that plugins are not supported at this moment on the new RBAC UI? 
I put some effort on the migration to 1.10 only to rollback because of the lack of support for plugins.
@Fokko Go for it - I didn't have the time to give this PR the attention it deserved.
This failed flake8 tests with a syntax error.

Well ofcourse.. It was stupid of me.. :D Reverted this

```
non-default argument follows default argument
```

@KimchaC I generally see the 50/50 usage of passing dag object vs using dag context manager in Airflow code. All example DAGs pass the dag object to the operators. Is there a preference for either by the Airflow community?

@ashb - we cant use a flag `BaseOperator.xcom_push` because this conflicts with the method `BaseOperator.xcom_push()`. I'll change the flag to be `BaseOperator.do_xcom_push`. it's already like this in some operators

Sorry, github is wonky for me today. First it wouldn't let me post comments and then it ended up with many duplicates and when I tried to clean them up it deleted all of them.

I previously wrote:
> Consider also changing the code to use the with context manager so that you don't have to repeat the dag=dag parameter on each task:
> ```
> dag = DAG(
>             'my_dag',
>             start_date=datetime(2016, 1, 1))
> with dag:
>     op = DummyOperator('op')
>
> op.dag is dag # True
> ```

To which @BasPH replied...
> @KimchaC I generally see the 50/50 usage of passing dag object vs using dag context manager in Airflow code. All example DAGs pass the dag object to the operators. Is there a preference for either by the Airflow community?

I think the airflow team should decide on a preference for the community. One of the reasons that it is not used by everyone is probably because not everyone is aware of this feature. One of the reasons for that is that the examples are not using it :)

Personally I think the with statement is awesome, makes the DAG code _much_ cleaner and reduces repetition.

I'd suggest adding a comment to the examples like...
```
# The with statement allows you to omit the dag parameter when initializing tasks.
with dag:
...
```

I also think the clode is clearer when the DAG is initiated separately and not inside the with statement.

@Fokko @gglanzani 
any updates on this?
What's the recommended way to proceed at this point? I'm glad to write more test code, but I'd love to have an end goal of where this needs to be to be mergeable.
I processed your changes except for @KimchaC's suggestion for using the DAG context manager, because I'm unsure what the Airflow team thinks about it?
@ashb `upgradedb` does not invoke `deactivate_unknown_dags` as far as I'm aware.
+1.  Looks good.

Well @ron819 @ashb thanks for your updates but I've never heard back from upstream and any interest in this so I will gladly rebase myself from the CLI implementation (which looks very close on a quick glance) if there's a chance for it to go in...

@sekikn  if the file storing encoded string, the `Payload` returned is bytes.

At https://github.com/sekikn/incubator-airflow/blob/288fca445ffcad718d39f413eddd8712a18dbf85/airflow/hooks/S3_hook.py#L248, `''.join()` will raise exception.

```
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/airflow/hooks/S3_hook.py", line 249, in select_key
    for event in response['Payload']
TypeError: sequence item 0: expected str instance, bytes found
```

Yeah this would be great to have!

To be clear: the implementation should live in the model (as you have in this PR) and be called from multiple places.
cc @fenglu-g

This PR seems sensible - though I would have fixed this by changing your deploy process to not kill your workers - you don't need to do that to pick up the latest version of DAGs. 

(Airflow is very careful to not load DAG definitions in to any long running process, so each time a task form a dag runs it will pick up the latest definition from disk)

OK @ashb I understand your precision and since you're a member of the project I'll work on this and update this PR with the hope for it to be considered.

I hope this time we make it :)
@kaxil, great ) thank you
@Ron819 I'm waiting for an ok here
Made the requested changes.

Hi @ashb, thank you for the review. I see what you mean, but we wanted to ensure that Airflow keeps track of Dataproc jobs even if the machine that hosts Airflow restarts for reasons outside our control. Our Airflow is hosted on machines that restart regularly for system updates (specifically, [GCP App Engine Flex instances that are restarted weekly by Google to install OS updates](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/flexible/python/how-instances-are-managed)).
Yeah, I can see this being useful. I don't know enough about GCP/DataProc in Airflow to review this further, sorry :)
Hi @gseva , as long as it's a code change, a JIRA ticket would be needed.

Tests failed due to flake8 style violation:

> ./tests/plugins/test_plugin.py:96:33: E261 at least two spaces before inline comment
This change seems to make the tests fail with `SSHException: No hostkey for host localhost found.` so we might probably need to update some tests too.
@jmcarp will this fix (as well as #3580) be included in airflow 1.10.1? And do you know when it will hapen? Thanks!

@ashb No worries and thank you! Oh, and the fix also helps in cases where the task fails for some other reason: for example, sometimes the Dataproc service is unavailable, and the Airflow task will fail because it can't check the status of the job, but the job is actually still running correctly.

@fenglu-g Hi Feng, this is the fix I emailed you about on February 27, 2018 with the subject line "Airflow losing track of running Dataproc jobs upon Airflow restart". Looking forward to any feedback you may have on this. Thank you!
@victornoel I've just marked them for inclusion in 1.10.1 so we don't forget. Most accurate I can offer on timings is "we're aiming for with in a month".
@ashb thanks for the quick answer!

@Wouter-M You have some conflicts to resolve

So, no love for the `with` operator?

Adding it to the examples would really go a long way to educate people about its existence. Perhaps one example dag can use it with comments and the others not. So that people can see that both are possible.

Wait, in previous code, 
```
# https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/f80138486e7828ff64fa544b4032a445b2ca140a/airflow/contrib/hooks/sftp_hook.py
if ignore_hostkey_verification == True => cnopts.hostkeys = None
```
```
# https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/a0489d09fe4b0d3a2e0893c9cfba0e379e79390b/airflow/contrib/hooks/sftp_hook.py
# https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/a0489d09fe4b0d3a2e0893c9cfba0e379e79390b/airflow/contrib/hooks/ssh_hook.py
if ignore_hostkey_verification == True => no_host_key_check = True  # inherit from SSHHook
if no_host_key_check == True => cnopts.hostkeys = None
```

flake8 check is failing due to lines i haven't edited. please can we merge?

probs also worth considering adding W504 to the flake8 ignore list / doing a bulk correct?
Will work on it.
+1.  Looks good.  Thanks.
@ashb, has this branch been intentionally pushed to the apache repo, or just a mistake?
@ms32035 Yes it was intentional. Do you think there's a reason not to have it here?
+1.  Looks good.  Thanks.
Not really. It was just so different from all other, that it made me wonder

I like the `with` operator.

And i also would like to have mixed examples with and without the `with` statement.
@ashb let me know if by any chance you got time to look at the issue?
Will this work equally well on sensors as well as regular tasks?
Hi @Fokko , I don't have further comment. Thanks
A side point: We may want to update the doc "**Scheduler Basic**" on Confluence https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/Scheduler+Basics accordingly after this PR is merged/released.
Ping @ashb when you have a minute

To make it work for regular operators I think the only thing to do is to override the `dep` function in your operator and add the `ReadyToRescheduleDep`, just like in https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3596/files#diff-81901d44cd480538f1f35b641b9ede0cR126. But I didn't test that yet.
I'm confused by the failing `flake8` test; there is no diff between the output of `flake8` on current master and this branch. Is this related to #4035 ?
The flake8 failures are because Flake8 updated and now has an extra check that it didn't have before. You can ignore that if it's reporting failures in code you haven't changed.
It's because of the new release of Flake8 only. This should be fixed later. Nothing pending for you I guess.
